problem: Determine the domain of the function $$g(x) = \frac{3x-7}{x^2 - 4x + 3}.$$ Express your domain in interval notation.
solution: First, factorize the denominator of the rational function: $$x^2 - 4x + 3 = (x-3)(x-1).$$ The domain of the rational function is all real numbers except where the denominator is zero. The denominator is zero at $x=3$ and $x=1$. Thus, the domain of $g(x)$ is $$x \in \boxed{(-\infty, 1) \cup (1, 3) \cup (3, \infty)}.$$
